Dear Mr. Rambo:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/02/2020. You have submitted an acceptable written corrective action plan covering
the violations cited in the report. The inspection has determined substantial compliance
with applicable licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
SRM 200 FINGERPRINTS
11 of 16 Personnel Training
All personnel, contractors, vendors and external auditors who
have access to CW-CHRI are required to complete security
awareness training (SAT). Training will be available on the
Learning Management System (LMS) for MDHHS personnel
and contractors with access to this system.
SAT is required to be taken within six months of being in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every two years thereafter.
CPAs are responsible for ensuring that all personnel with CHRI
access completes the SAT. DCWL consultants will monitor
completion of SAT in all CPAs as part of the annual licensing
audit.
Two of 3 employees required to complete Security Awareness Training (SAT) failed
to have re-training within the two year time frame.
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(e) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations from either of the following:
(i) The Michigan state police or the equivalent state or
Canadian provincial law enforcement agency where the person
usually resides.
(ii) An entity accessing either Michigan state police
records or equivalent state or Canadian provincial law
enforcement agency where the person usually resides.
One of 3 new personnel files reviewed did not have the required criminal clearance
in the personnel record.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
There were no additional MISEP violations.
4

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
There were no additional policy or contract violations.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan which was approved on
09/03/2019. The CAP covered:
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
FOM 722-06H CASE CONTACTS
The primary caseworker must have face-to-face contact with
each child as indicated below.
First Two Months after Initial Placement or a Placement Change
There were no repeat violations.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. An acceptable
5

corrective action plan was received on 09/02/2020, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
